required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Horizontal vs. Vertical Positioning of the iCare Rebound Tonometer and Effects on Intraocular Pressure Readings
clinical_study.official_title: Horizontal vs. Vertical Positioning of the iCare Rebound Tonometer and Effects on Intraocular Pressure Readings

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to evaluate the agreement between intraocular pressure (IOP) measurements taken by iCare, held in both vertical and horizontal positions. In addition, iCare measurements will be compared against pneumotonometry measurements to assess for accuracy.

arm_group.description: In the horizontal iCare arm, these patients were randomized to have their IOP measured with the iCare tonometer held in the horizontal position first and then their IOP measured with the iCare tonometer held in the vertical position.

In the vertical iCare arm, these patients were randomized to have their IOP measured with the iCare tonometer held in the vertical position first and then their IOP measured with the iCare tonometer held in the horizontal position.

intervention.description: IOP of the right eye will be measured using the iCare tonometer held in the horizontal position first and then in the vertical position.
IOP of the right eye will be measured using the iCare tonometer held in the vertical position first and then in the horizontal position.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older
- Must be able to understand and sign and informed consent form that has been approved by an Institutional Review Board/Ethics Committee
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of corneal epithelial defects or pathology affecting corneal rigidity
- Use of topical ophthalmic medications (except for artificial tears)
- History or corneal surgeries
- Any condition that would prevent or inhibit intraocular pressure measurements using iCare or pneumotonometry
- Evidence of ocular infection 30 days prior to enrollment
- Allergy to proparacaine or latex

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
